content.question: ​The rational function <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses equals fraction numerator 2 x to the power of 5 plus 5 x cubed minus 2 x squared minus 13 over denominator 3 x squared minus 2 x plus 7 end fraction"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>13</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfrac></math>. Which of the following describes the end behavior of <math alttext="h"><mi>h</mi></math> ?

choices.label: ​As <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> increases without bound, and as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> decreases without bound.

​As <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> increases without bound, and as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> increases without bound.

​As <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> decreases without bound, and as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> increases without bound.

​As <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> decreases without bound, and as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> decreases without bound.

content.answer: ​As <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> increases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> increases without bound, and as <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math> decreases without bound, <math alttext="h open parentheses x close parentheses"><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced></math> decreases without bound.

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
